eventName: The Other Side of the Deck
storyName: The Other Side of the Deck
storyInfo: Finish up a day of work, call up a few buds, play cards, drink, gossip about—Noir Corne loves these kinds of ordinary days the most.

attributes.content: 19:46 P.M. \ Clear
Rhodes Island Landship, Operator Rest Area, Bar
How many cards?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I'll take two.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Let me see... I'll have one.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Noir Corne?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I'm out.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Luck's not smiling today, eh, bro?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Aw, man, I bet it's because I took the wrong mask out! Dammit.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Been busy enough recently, huh? I heard you were helping ops with simulation training, all on top of your run of field missions.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Nah, an extra shift once in a while's no big.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And I mean, I like training with all the newcomers. Youngsters with a love for life.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Haven't you always been pretty popular, Noir?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: When I first arrived, I saw your mask, and I thought 'old, serious mentor type.' Swear I didn't even dare talk to you. Who knew you'd take me for drinks right after training, eh...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Wait, old mentor? Am I really that old? If you don't take that back, your next round's not on me!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: As a bro! I mean as a solid, dependable bro.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Hey, bro. I'll take another card.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: You know, Dylan, if you got out more and spent less time crammed in your cockpit, you'd be more popular too.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Forget it, goofing off in there suits me. If Noir didn't invite me, I wouldn't have wanted to come out.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: ...I'm more of the hiding sort too.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Last time I saw Noir Corne and the Doctor show up together, I ducked behind a wall on sheer reflex.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Haha, that's just you overreacting, isn't it?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I can't help it. After we got back from Lungmen, I had nightmares a couple straight days in a row.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: It takes a lot of guts to keep working with Dr. Kal'tsit watching, and then when I saw the Doctor and all the others in the squad at the time, and the herd showing up in front of us...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: That was... a terrifying scene.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Man, that's just rough, bud. What about you, Noir? You went too, right?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: I'm good enough.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: But that battle was pretty intense. Can't blame Chard. Even I'm still a little stressed about it.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: ...I'll have another glass. Talking about this made me break a sweat.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Yeah, me too, gimme the... Water of Life with vanilla soda!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Not gonna drink, Noir?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: I'll pass.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Yo, you're worried Yato's gonna tell you off, huh? Never seen you hold back before.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Hey, hey. I'm older than you guys. Lay off the wisecracks.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: —I'll give you the double-demon killer!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: C'mon, you're just bluffing again. You're the worst actor every time you do this, y'know!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: (Scratches mask) You serious?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Dammit. Don't they say masks hide your expression, make it easier to scare people?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Don't forget tone of voice. The moment you start bluffing, you sound super tense! It's like telling everyone what you're about to do. Anyone'd figure out the act, y'know?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Oh? I guess my acting still needs some work, then.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Oh, well. This next one's on me. You guys drink happy.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: ...If you say so. Give me another one.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Ease off, Chard. I don't want a repeat of you at the toilet bowl hurling and crying, yelling your daughter and ex-wife's names.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: That last celebration dinner, if Noir Corne didn't carry you back to your place, you would've embarrassed yourself in front of the Doctor and Dr. Kal'tsit all night long.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: (Groan)
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: You gotta lay off him now. Keep going and he'll pass out clutching the whole bottle, haha.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Chard's having a hard time. Went through a rough battle, returned living, and couldn't even tell the people that mattered about it. I know how that hits. You guys stop joking about him.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Thanks... s-see, I was genuinely scared... I wish I could be like you, Noir Corne, I've never seen you freeze up in any situation...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: I've just been round the block a few more times. Everyone'll get used to it after a while.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Once I got back, I couldn't help picturing that scene. Those kind of conditions, that sort of place... if you left me to do anything alone right there, I wouldn't have made one step forward. Wouldn't have dared fall one step back.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Dr. Kal'tsit told me to think of my daughter. She said, if we won, I'd have a chance to see her again.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: *Sigh*... I already know the thing, doctor. No matter if I die there or not, whether I get to see her again isn't my place to say.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: I feel you.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The reason I... the reason I could keep walking was because she said we could win. I chose... *hic* to listen to that.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Then when we got back, I saw her and the Doctor again, and I was ashamed like nothing else. In that one moment, I was actually doubting we could win!
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: I'm not saying this to be nice, Chard—that mindset? I've thought like that too.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I've been through a lot of conflicts before. Used to just fight one battle to make it to the next, and when all was said and done, who won and who lost had nothing to do with a small fry like me.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Feeling like you can't win is normal. When you can't beat them, run, because your life's what's important. If you can keep just making it through the days, your job's done.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It's totally normal. Plenty of mercenaries think that way.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I used to run a security company outside, and people got the services they paid for, no other questions asked.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Then coming to Rhodes Island, same as the boss here, my mentality began to change.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I've been on plenty of missions with the Doctor. I slowly got to thinking, if we can win, and keep on winning at it, that's actually pretty slick!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Like that, I passed each day, hauling my weight on the battlefield, and now I'm even pumped for training. I'm practically keeping up with the young kids.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I wanna win too. I've always believed in what all the doctors are doing.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: I wanna see my daughter, even if rationally, the odds are almost nothing. I'm still not gonna give up on them.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Hey, hey, that's the spirit! Good on you!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Rhodes Island always needs guys like us, after all. Is it our fault, really, we're not as strong, or we can hesitate, or we can get scared?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The Doctor told me to 'defend your own position,' and I did it. I've earned the pay, and I've earned the Doctor's trust.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And you were with Dr. Kal'tsit all the way to the end. You gonna tell me she chewed you out for it after coming back?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: No. She... she actually commended me.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: You see? Just like I said, right?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Yeah. I think you've actually helped me get past it a little.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: But I still don't have the kind of good mentality you do. At the most, I won't hide behind a pillar next time I see the Doctor. Might even say hello by myself. See, you know, there's a whole lot of long-time ops who make the Doc sound mighty impressive.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: We were on the same mission last time, sure... urp. But in the end, we didn't get to talk much.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Thinking about it, the Doctor sure as hell wouldn't remember me now... ugghhh...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Alright, Chard, I can safely say you're drunk again.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Lemme ease you up, buddy.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Better?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Phew... yeah, better...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: I just wanna say, it doesn't mean someone's difficult when they cover up their face. You know that looking at me, don't you?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: You can see for yourself the way the Doctor is, now we're all off the battlefield.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Once you're familiar, you'll realize the Doctor's not much different from us. There's two eyes and a mouth in there, a slacker, someone who makes mistakes, who worries about the schedules of every single department on this landship every day.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Yeah, now that you mention it, the Doc might be coming along on my next field mission soon!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: That's a hell of a good chance. Right this moment, I'm even more curious about the Doctor than I am about what's under your mask, Noir!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Haha... that's good, yeah.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Are you okay, Chard? Should we keep going?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: *cough*... Yeah, let's keep going. I'm much better now.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: What's your hand?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Straight flush, yuccas!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Looks like you've lost again, Noir!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: If we keep drinking at this rate, we're gonna run the liquor cabinet dry. We need some different stakes.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Then... if Noir loses again, he's gotta take his mask off!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Hey, hey, that's not gonna fly. It's not like I'm not willing, it's just you guys might be disappointed.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Yeah, the more you deflect, the more curious I get! I've been so curious, I've even dreamt it in my nightmares...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: What did you dream?
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Noir finally took off his mask, and underneath was another mask. And it was just one after another, kept going forever.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: That's a nightmare for sure. I've got goosebumps now.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Oh yeah, that's a pretty solid dream. I like it.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: If I could put on a bunch of masks in one go, I wouldn't have to worry about which one to wear every morning.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Come on, shatter the mystery, bro... I don't wanna dream about you every night!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Naughty, haunting Dylan's dreams. Looks like sometimes secrets are charming too.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I'm not kidding you guys, I don't have much of a secret. If you actually wanna look, I can—
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Uh, nah!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Noir, you just stay as you are, bro, I think that's best. I'm worried you'd throw me for a loop if you actually had the mask off.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: So, same as always, then?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Man, you guys. You wanna hear me tell stories again?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: C'mon, bring it on! Your stories are the best part of playing cards.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Hm, lemme think. Last time we got to...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It was a rainy evening, and a mom and her kid were hiding in a... ruined temple? Then an Oni ran into them.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Wow, Chard, that's a killer memory you've got! Yeah, it was all like a scary movie. Then what happened?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: —The Oni was there to kill.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Kill? And I thought the Oni'd be a good guy.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Right then, he was just an Oni someone told to go killing, so he went killing.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Sounds like he's got it pretty tough...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: The Oni knocked the mom out, but when he had the daughter nabbed, it hit him she was just seven or eight, scared so bad she couldn't even scream.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The Oni thought to himself, 'it's for the mission, that's how it is,' getting ready to slaughter her.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: That's when he noticed his strike being blocked by a blade.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: That's cool!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Yeah, it was real cool, even I thought so. Uh, I mean, the Oni in the story thought so.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The light off that blade was real bright that night. The Oni couldn't help but fall back a little.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: I get it, this was the hero coming to save the mom and kid, right?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Ha, the Oni was thinking that too.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: He reckoned, if he couldn't win the fight, then forget it. Not like he was interested in killing anyone anyway. Act like he got hurt, treat the mission as a failure, and it's not like anyone would give him a hard time for it.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Only then did the Oni realize... the one who blocked his attack was another Oni.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Huh? Why'd that Oni come save the family, then?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: At the time, he couldn't figure it out either. The weirdest thing was, seemed the other Oni was a whole other clan's lackey. Her head and his head were both out for the same thing, that girl's life.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Seriously? She held you off just so she could get her own kill?
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: The Oni guessed the same thing. He threw some hands with the other Oni, which led him to realize she actually wanted to save the kid.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: So he asked her, what is it you wanna do?!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And she told him, she didn't wanna do anything. She just didn't wanna hurt another innocent person.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: That stunned the Oni. He never once figured that was an option they could take.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Hey, sounds like he was a nice, soft guy... uh, soft Oni.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yeah. He decided then and there, he'd let the girl go.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Because he was moved by the other Oni?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Ha... and maybe because he wasn't a match for her.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Giving up the mission yourself, that amounts to desertion. The powers on both their sides wouldn't let a traitor off easy, would they?
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Yeah, so he came to the conclusion, he could only desert with the other Oni.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Man, fleeing together to the ends of the world! This turned from a horror story into a romance story.
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: It wasn't that romantic, was it? Trying to run away's not an easy thing... they got hurt together, they fell ill together. Had more than a couple close scrapes with death.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Not to mention, the other Oni couldn't stand being in sunlight. And nowhere's quick to trust you when you're always wearing a mask.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The Oni was obsessed, because masks were obviously pretty sweet, so he spent some crazy effort getting a whole pile of them.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: A pile of masks?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Yeah, that was hard-earned as hell. Every mask was passed down by a different clan for a millennium, and had secret powers unbeknownst to anyone...
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: This is getting wilder by the second.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: What kind of secret powers is a mask gonna have?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: For example, you wear it and you're unaging and immortal. You get a huge strength boost or something.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Yeah, take that day, for instance. The Oni got his hands on the most fearsome mask of them all, and it came at a huge price. Almost cost him his life.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: The other Oni was worried as hell for him. With all the guys chasing him, he did what he could in the moment, and put the mask straight on!
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And in that instant, sand and stone came flying up, and every last enemy went pale—
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And the Oni yelled in this huge voice, 'I've broken the limits!'
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And then in a huge blast of spiritual energy, he sent every last bad guy packing.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Huh? What? That's way too sloppy for an ending! C'mon, Noir, every time you finish up, your stories just get more and more bizarre...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Well, hey, looks like I won, huh?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Huuuh?! I got way too absorbed in the story...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Same here...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Same all around, huh.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: I see how it is! This is your special technique, isn't it, Noir?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Hey, hey, it's more effective than trying to bluff people out.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Augh, I still wanna hear more stories about the two Oni...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: The one from before with the Oni challenging ten generals in a row on the night of a snowstorm, that was amazing!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Yeah, we'll leave it for next time. Looks to me like Chard's eyes are almost gluing shut.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: When you're out from your field mission, then we can go for drinks again.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Hey, that's the Doctor, isn't it?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: What? I was just staring at the cards—I didn't even notice!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Must've heard everything we were just talking about...
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: I... *cough* *cough* *cough*... I feel dizzy as hell...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Too late to act drunk, Chard.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Doctor, I never imagined you'd drop in at the bar.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.options: Amiya suggested I come over and relax.;......;Is my camouflage module on the fritz?

attributes.content: Whaddaya nudging me for, you guys...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: *cough*... Doctor, been ages since... uh, good evening!
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: *huff*...
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.options: Good evening, Operators Chard, Dylan, Barty, Noir Corne.

attributes.content: Doctor, you... you actually remember all our names?!
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Your memory's still as good as ever, Doctor.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Getting into your mountain of paperwork, and remembering all our personnel's names on top of that, it's not easy. Doctor, watch you don't get worn out.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.options: It's just what I ought to do.;......;PRTS helps me out.

attributes.content: Doctor, we're about to pack up right now. We'll give you some peace and quiet.
attributes.name: Operator Barty

attributes.content: Uh-huh. Doctor, see you on the field mission!
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: We're out, Chard, what are you stuck to the ground for?
attributes.name: Operator Dylan

attributes.content: Huh? Yeah... *cough*, see you, Doctor.
attributes.name: Operator Chard

attributes.content: Doctor, you don't mind if I sit down here, right?
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: Just now, we were meeting up after work, drinking and shooting the breeze. Must've been a comedy show for you.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: They still don't really know what to make of you. But I know it well. You're fun, interesting, and a real good person.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: It's your command, y'know, that lets guys like me find their proper position in a scene all tossed about head to tail.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: And my position—is right here.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.options: You eat char-grilled sandworm leg?;Want some spicy cactus jerky?

attributes.content: I'll go for anything. It's all tasty.
attributes.name: Noir Corne

attributes.content: How about a drink with me, Doctor? A glass every now and then's no big deal.
attributes.name: Noir Corne
